018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor;
019
020import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
021import static org.junit.Assert.assertFalse;
022import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
023
024import java.io.IOException;
025import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClassTestRule;
026import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility;
027import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterCoprocessorHost;
028import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterServices;
029import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.MockMasterServices;
030import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.CoprocessorTests;
031import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.SmallTests;
032import org.junit.After;
033import org.junit.Before;
034import org.junit.ClassRule;
035import org.junit.Rule;
036import org.junit.Test;
037import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
038import org.junit.rules.TestName;
039
040/**
041 * Test CoreCoprocessor Annotation works giving access to facility not usually available. Test
042 * MasterCoprocessor.
043 */
044@Category({ CoprocessorTests.class, SmallTests.class })
045public class TestCoreMasterCoprocessor {
046  @ClassRule
047  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
048    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestCoreMasterCoprocessor.class);
049
050  @Rule
051  public TestName name = new TestName();
052  private static final HBaseTestingUtility HTU = HBaseTestingUtility.createLocalHTU();
053  private MasterServices ms;
054  private MasterCoprocessorHost mch;
055
056  @Before
057  public void before() throws Exception {
058    this.ms = new MockMasterServices(HTU.getConfiguration());
059    this.mch = new MasterCoprocessorHost(this.ms, HTU.getConfiguration());
060    this.mch.preMasterInitialization();
061  }
062
063  @After
064  public void after() throws IOException {
065    this.mch.preStopMaster();
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * No annotation with CoreCoprocessor. This should make it so I can NOT get at instance of a
070   * MasterServices instance after some gymnastics.
071   */
072  public static class NotCoreMasterCoprocessor implements MasterCoprocessor {
073    public NotCoreMasterCoprocessor() {
074    }
075  }
076
077  /**
078   * Annotate with CoreCoprocessor. This should make it so I can get at instance of a MasterServices
079   * instance after some gymnastics.
080   */
081  @CoreCoprocessor
082  public static class CoreMasterCoprocessor implements MasterCoprocessor {
083    public CoreMasterCoprocessor() {
084    }
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Assert that when a Coprocessor is annotated with CoreCoprocessor, then it is possible to access
089   * a MasterServices instance. Assert the opposite too. Do it to MasterCoprocessors.
090   */
091  @Test
092  public void testCoreRegionCoprocessor() throws IOException {
093    MasterCoprocessorEnvironment env =
094      this.mch.load(null, NotCoreMasterCoprocessor.class.getName(), 0, HTU.getConfiguration());
095    assertFalse(env instanceof HasMasterServices);
096    env = this.mch.load(null, CoreMasterCoprocessor.class.getName(), 1, HTU.getConfiguration());
097    assertTrue(env instanceof HasMasterServices);
098    assertEquals(this.ms, ((HasMasterServices) env).getMasterServices());
099  }
100}
